title: RMB
text:
Hello! I am Rolen Muana, an undergraduate student currently taking BS Applied Mathematics with specialization in Data Science at the Ateneo de Manila University.
This site is currently hosting–


updates on my projects and activities;

discussions on books and problems; and

other interesting materials.

If you would like to collaborate, or have comments or suggestions, feel free to send me an email. I will try to respond promptly.

title: Post With Code
text: This is a post with executable code.

title: Notes for CPZ
text: This post serves as a compilation of interesting results from Mathematical Proofs: A Transition to Advanced Mathematics (4th Edition) by Chartrands, Polimeni, and Zhang.

title: Notes for CPZ
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis





 Oh snap! Change a few things up and try submitting again.
